attributes.action: Intervene with Northern Rock's policy of not reflecting interest rate cuts to old customers
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The Labour government tried to stabilise the downturn by propping up failing banks from complete collapse such as Northern Rock. It appears Northern Rock is not willing to reciprocate with the current trend of rate cuts by Bank of England. 
Their site still says that they have no new deals for those who already have mortgages with them.
They tend to emphasise how to help when in trouble. Help is better felt through cuts.
Prime Minister sir, I have cut and paste a comment by President elect Obama: "We have not focused on foreclosures and what is happening to homeowners as much as I would like," Mr Obama said. "We've got to set up a negotiation between banks and borrowers so that people can stay in their homes. That is going to have an impact on the economy as a whole."  
I think sir, that it is about time the government considers its policy of restraint.
Northern Rock should be helping  and not acting against. Our home is the only thing we have and it is our pride sir.
Please help.

rejection.details:
There are several petitions in existence already:
http://petitions.number10.gov.uk/nr-rate-cuts/
